content.description: This climbs a splitter crack on the boulder to the left of Leafpool.
content.location: Start in the fingercrack using it as an undercling, and get your feet on the slopey ledge. Climb the crack that varies between sizes, and top out.

content.description: Power out of the cave to the face on positive holds trending left. After gaining the BUCKET, move up into the "arch"(crux) on sidepulls to a directional and pocket, big moves left to big holds keep you hustling to a hidden bucket at the top out.
content.location: The line breaks through the two traverses, going UP & LEFT @ the right side of the bloc. The best and the most climbing the wall offers, top it out!

content.description:
This is a fun route on the west face of Burger Boulder.  It ascends a right-diagonaling, traverse crack to the right edge of the face.  You could do this as a foot traverse, but a hand traverse is more obvious.  Gain the right edge and do some easier climbing to the top of the boulder. 

  There is a more direct start that starts a bit to the right at 5.10. 

  There is an extendo start to the left, Back Door Man, 11.
content.protection: TR is probably best.  2 old manky bolts on top were the anchors a while back.
content.location: This ascends the low, right-angling, traverse crack.

content.description: This is a variation to Leafpool that goes around the corner to the right and climbs the big slab face.
content.location: Start as for Leafpool, but traverse right around the corner on good sidepulls and amazing foot holds. Climb the cracked slab that leads to the top.

content.description: This is a short but fun climb that is located on a boulder about 20 feet behind the main face of the Burger Boulder.
content.location: Start on an edge on the left side of the boulder, and step on the massive foot ledge. Climb straight up, and top out.

content.description:
Start with a left on a good pinch and a right on an edge. Bump your right hand up a few times to a horribly sharp, 2-finger pocket, then top out on hidden, positive holds. 

  The arete to right and crack system to left are both off.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter are nice, some good backbreakers exist on the left side of the landing.
content.location: Ascend the road-facing face of the prominent, 12-foot boulder right next to Wompatuck Rd. at the Rattlesnake Rocks fire road entrance.

content.description: Start low and to the left on a slight overhang. Move right with a couple long reaches and tricky feet onto the slab-like face. Go up and to the left before a big reach to the jug near the top.
content.protection: A pad. There is a decent landing for this one (unlike everything else in the area).
content.location: This route is on the same fire road boulder as Illegal Arête Extreme, thus the name. It is on the slab type feature to the right of the aforementioned arête. I am happy to update if a different name already exists....

content.description: This is more of a highball, seeing as the crux is right off the ground (talus!). After the traverse crux and a big reach, sinker buckets get you to the top.
content.location: On the leftmost face, start off a large undercling and goes to a left-angling traverse up into the shallow dihedral.

content.description:
This route traverses the Sodom & Gomorrah crack but starts lower and further to the left with some technical moves, though the rest of the route demands endurance for its short length. After ascending the slopey arete (find those hidden holds!), traverse left on dirty pockets to a hard lockoff and finish as for the topout of "Cruisin' for Burgers". 

  Good sustained climbing, steepness, and solid (for Rattlesnake) rock all conspire to make this an area classic. As with the whole Burger Boulder, it is very aesthetic compared to most of the rock in the area.
content.protection: There are two old-ish (but solid) bolts at the top, as well as a glue-in ring bolt as a backup.
content.location: This ascends the obvious face of the Burger Boulder.

content.description:
This is a nice chunk of quality rock that is probably all of 25 ft tall at the most.  It actually lies just north of Wampatuck Rd.  It is approached via hiking up the dirt road a short way, then breaking off right on the first faint trail, heading E for a ways.  It lies just S of Ships Prow.  Long slings are useful for anchors.  While you can boulder these problems, a fall could prove costly.  Old bolts & pins on top can be supplemented with gear including a #10 hex. 

  L->R:   A. Roll Me Over, 7   B. Cruisin For Burgers, 11   CD. Back Door Man, 11   D. Sodom and Gomorrah, 9   E. Buns Up, 10 

  F? Pink in the Middle, 13-, 1p.   G? Sodom Hussein, 12, 1p, 30', bolts.
